name: Intermediary Relending Program
objective: Establish revolving loan funds for the purpose of providing loans to ultimate recipients to promote community development, establish new businesses, establish and support microlending programs, and increase access to capital for start-ups and other small rural businesses and cooperatives in rural areas. Program performance is measured by the number of jobs created/saved and businesses assisted. The Agency tries to maintain a low default rate.
assistance_types: State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)
applicant_types: Local (includes State-designated Indian Tribes, excludes institutions of higher education and hospitals
Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)

results.description: 11 awards were issued under this program in FY24.

rules_regulations: 7 CFR 4274, Subpart D; 7 CFR 1951, Subpart R.
